item.title: My custom ::yell Command
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Your playerRights are equal to three, therefore the expression evaluates to true and it will put the co-owner tag beside your name.
Use this:

if(command.startsWith("yell"))
{
    String message = command.substring(5);
    if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Xile"))
    {
        yell("[Owner] " + playerName + ": " + message);
    }
    else
    if(playerRights == 3)
    {
        yell("[Co-Owner] " + playerName + ": " + message);
    }
    else
    {
        yell(playerName + ": " + message);
    }
}

Read full topic

item.title: My custom ::yell Command
item.dc:creator: @Xile_Maizez Xile Maizez
item.description:
@Xile_Maizez wrote:

Hey everyone, I was making my own yell command, so that whenever a Co-Owner ( Rights = 3 ) uses ::yells it says “[Co-Owner]” Before their name, and whenever I say it, it says “[Owner]” Then my name. Here’s the code I was working on:

if (command.startsWith("yell") && playerRights == 3) {
	String message = command.substring(5);
		yell("[Co-Owner] " + playerName + ": "+message+"");
	} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xile")) {
		String message = command.substring(5);
		yell("[Owner] " + playerName + ": "+message+"");
	}

Whenever I use ::yell it says “[Co-Owner]” before my name not “[Owner]” Whats wrong?
Thanks.

Read full topic
